rev.desc.rev.desc: Quotes (ocmq) is not created successfully
When using RM WSDL to open a new request, if a validation in a format control fails the error message is not proper
add not null check in panel pre.add.record
add '$' in panel pre.add, to avoid exception
Category in request management is not filled from service catalog
Add one new panel pre.add.record to set the last line item category to quote subcategory
Quote is not generated from Service Catalog when Quote Category names are similar
When opening a Request Management Quote via Web Services, the Requestor (requested.for) field is blank
rootcause:

the field 'requested.for' value was always replaced by the value of field 'requested.for' in file ocmcowork regardless its value is empty or not during open the quote. This issue also exists in client.
solution:
check the field 'requested.for' is empty or not before pass value of filed 'requested.for' form file $L.work to file $L.file
RAD:Rmq.open
Panel:Init.vars
Change
From
if ($L.filename="ocmq" and not null($L.work)) then (requested.for in $L.file=requested.for in $L.work)
To
if ($L.filename="ocmq" and not null($L.work) and not null(requested.for in $L.work)) then (requested.for in $L.file=requested.for in $L.work)
It seems that SM mismatch the following two fields in the environemnt.ocml.g/environment.ocmq.g/environment.ocmo.g form design:
1)skip.warning
2)full.name
modify init.vars panel to fix this issue.
Fixed looping issue when there was only one category.
SCR38712 - Panel 'copy.model'
Changed 'Model Link' from 'model.link in $L.category' to 'model.link in $L.phase'
Flag bad validation when opening a request and send users back.
DE2130: modified to add cart item requested for to the work file and later to the request line item.
Deal with bad validation in FC
Added line $L.temp=bundles in $L.work;bundles in $L.file=$L.temp on panel open.components to save bundle information
Panel get.object - Changed normal exit from get.env to check.auth
Panel get.env - deleted panel
Added $INTO.WORK variable and setting it for Service Catalog.
Added the $L.file.save variable to parameters passed to alert.schedule.

rmq.open application changes: init.vars panel From: $L.confirm="open" To: scmsg(501, "ocm")
From: $L.confirm="open the next phase of" To: $L.confirm=scmsg(502, "ocm")
From: $L.confirm="change the category of" To: $L.confirm=scmsg(503, "ocm")
From: $L.confirm="change the phase of" To: $L.confirm=scmsg(504, "ocm")
From: $L.confirm="copy and open" To: $L.confirm=scmsg(505, "ocm")
added 5 new scmessage records
Class Message ID Message ocm 501 open ocm 502 open the next phase of ocm 503 change the category of ocm 504 change the phase of ocm 505 copy and open
Added $L.file to the Quote/Order Record parm on the build.phase.logs panel.
panel: check.bg
removed the following exits:
exit: open.script
cond: not $L.copy and evaluate(post.opn.script.cond in $L.phase)
exit: copyopen.script
cond: $L.copy and evaluate(cpy.script.cond in $L.phase)
changed the normal exit from:
reinit.file
to
check.validate.fields
This way the user will still get taken to the next screen and will be able to fill in any data. However, the validation will not persist at this point unless it is also set to execute on update.
Added processing to check for operator profile authorization BEFORE the open script is executed.
Changed expression on select.phase.0 panel to allow request orders to be opened.
Added "add" to the Mode parm on the schedule.alerts panel.

Added a new panel called select.phase.0 which checks the phase condition and sets the 1st phase. Renamed the "Name of Phase to Extract" variable on the select.phase panel to "$L.first.phase" (was "1 in phases in $L.category").
Implemented SCRs 25809, 25483, 24900.
Added in new field calculation to move admin.follow.time from phase record to the quote.
Modified set.fields to set up number controls for yr-mo and Julian.
Changed select.categories backup exit from exit.normal to exit.back. On check.added, exit to exit.menu if $L.exit="cancel" or "menu".
Now calls get.base.form.name to set up the format control name. The master.fc field in the object record is referenced instead of the filename to select the master format control record.
Fixed a problem where the number would change on a copy routine if the copy was cancelled.
Added in old subtotal code.
Modified so that if no parts are found for a category the category list is again given to user.
Added pre and post script options.
No changes. Removed extraneous panels.

descript.descript: Quotes (ocmq) is not created successfully
When using RM WSDL to open a new request, if a validation in a format control fails the error message is not proper
add not null check in panel pre.add.record
add '$' in panel pre.add, to avoid exception
Category in request management is not filled from service catalog
Add one new panel pre.add.record to set the last line item category to quote subcategory
Quote is not generated from Service Catalog when Quote Category names are similar
When opening a Request Management Quote via Web Services, the Requestor (requested.for) field is blank
rootcause:

the field 'requested.for' value was always replaced by the value of field 'requested.for' in file ocmcowork regardless its value is empty or not during open the quote. This issue also exists in client.
solution:
check the field 'requested.for' is empty or not before pass value of filed 'requested.for' form file $L.work to file $L.file
RAD:Rmq.open
Panel:Init.vars
Change
From
if ($L.filename="ocmq" and not null($L.work)) then (requested.for in $L.file=requested.for in $L.work)
To
if ($L.filename="ocmq" and not null($L.work) and not null(requested.for in $L.work)) then (requested.for in $L.file=requested.for in $L.work)
It seems that SM mismatch the following two fields in the environemnt.ocml.g/environment.ocmq.g/environment.ocmo.g form design:
1)skip.warning
2)full.name
modify init.vars panel to fix this issue.
Fixed looping issue when there was only one category.
SCR38712 - Panel 'copy.model'
Changed 'Model Link' from 'model.link in $L.category' to 'model.link in $L.phase'
Flag bad validation when opening a request and send users back.
DE2130: modified to add cart item requested for to the work file and later to the request line item.
Deal with bad validation in FC
Added line $L.temp=bundles in $L.work;bundles in $L.file=$L.temp on panel open.components to save bundle information
Panel get.object - Changed normal exit from get.env to check.auth
Panel get.env - deleted panel
Added $INTO.WORK variable and setting it for Service Catalog.
Added the $L.file.save variable to parameters passed to alert.schedule.

rmq.open application changes: init.vars panel From: $L.confirm="open" To: scmsg(501, "ocm")
From: $L.confirm="open the next phase of" To: $L.confirm=scmsg(502, "ocm")
From: $L.confirm="change the category of" To: $L.confirm=scmsg(503, "ocm")
From: $L.confirm="change the phase of" To: $L.confirm=scmsg(504, "ocm")
From: $L.confirm="copy and open" To: $L.confirm=scmsg(505, "ocm")
added 5 new scmessage records
Class Message ID Message ocm 501 open ocm 502 open the next phase of ocm 503 change the category of ocm 504 change the phase of ocm 505 copy and open
Added $L.file to the Quote/Order Record parm on the build.phase.logs panel.
panel: check.bg
removed the following exits:
exit: open.script
cond: not $L.copy and evaluate(post.opn.script.cond in $L.phase)
exit: copyopen.script
cond: $L.copy and evaluate(cpy.script.cond in $L.phase)
changed the normal exit from:
reinit.file
to
check.validate.fields
This way the user will still get taken to the next screen and will be able to fill in any data. However, the validation will not persist at this point unless it is also set to execute on update.
Added processing to check for operator profile authorization BEFORE the open script is executed.
Changed expression on select.phase.0 panel to allow request orders to be opened.
Added "add" to the Mode parm on the schedule.alerts panel.

Added a new panel called select.phase.0 which checks the phase condition and sets the 1st phase. Renamed the "Name of Phase to Extract" variable on the select.phase panel to "$L.first.phase" (was "1 in phases in $L.category").
Implemented SCRs 25809, 25483, 24900.
Added in new field calculation to move admin.follow.time from phase record to the quote.
Modified set.fields to set up number controls for yr-mo and Julian.
Changed select.categories backup exit from exit.normal to exit.back. On check.added, exit to exit.menu if $L.exit="cancel" or "menu".
Now calls get.base.form.name to set up the format control name. The master.fc field in the object record is referenced instead of the filename to select the master format control record.
Fixed a problem where the number would change on a copy routine if the copy was cancelled.
Added in old subtotal code.
Modified so that if no parts are found for a category the category list is again given to user.
Added pre and post script options.
No changes. Removed extraneous panels.
